<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Seller&#148; means Franklin Receivables LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, and its successors in interest to the extent permitted hereunder.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Seller Indemnification Cap&#148; has the meaning assigned thereto in Section 6.3 of this Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Servicer&#148; means Franklin Capital, as the servicer of the Receivables, and each successor Servicer pursuant to Section 7.3 or 8.2 of this Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Servicer Default&#148; means an event specified in Section 8.1 of this Agreement. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Servicer Deposit Support Agreement&#148; means the Servicer Deposit Support Agreement dated December 15, 2004, made by Franklin Resources in favor of the Trustee under the Indenture.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Servicer&#146;s Certificate&#148; means an Officer&#146;s Certificate of the Servicer delivered pursuant to Section 4.9 of this Agreement, substantially in the form of Exhibit D to this Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Servicing Fee&#148; has the meaning specified in Section 4.8 of this Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Servicing Fee Rate&#148; means with respect to (i) Prime Receivables, 1.0% per annum, (ii) Non-Prime Receivables, 1.50% per annum and (iii) Sub-Prime Receivables, 2.0% per annum.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Simple Interest Method&#148; means the method of allocating a fixed level payment to principal and interest, pursuant to which the portion of such payment that is allocated to interest is equal to the product of the fixed rate of interest multiplied by the unpaid principal balance multiplied by the period of time elapsed since the preceding payment of interest was made (in some states assuming 30 day months), divided by the actual number of days in a year (360 days in states which assume 30 day months) and the remainder of such payment is allocable to principal.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Simple Interest Receivable&#148; means any Receivable under which the portions of a payment allocable to interest and principal are determined in accordance with the Simple Interest Method.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Spread Account&#148; means a segregated trust account which is also an Eligible Deposit Account for the benefit of the Security Insurer established and governed by the Spread Account Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Spread Account Agreement&#148; means the Spread Account and Payment Agreement dated as of December 1, 2004 by and among the Seller, the Servicer, the Representative, the Security Insurer and The Bank of New York.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Spread Account Deposit Amounts&#148; means the amounts required to be deposited into the Spread Account pursuant to the Spread Account Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Spread Account Deposit Event&#148; has the meaning assigned to such term in the Spread Account Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Standard &amp; Poor&#146;s&#148; means Standard &amp; Poor&#146;s, a division of The McGraw Hill Companies, Inc.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Sub Prime Receivables&#148; means those Receivables indicated on Schedule A hereto as sub-prime.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Subsequent Cutoff Date&#148; means, with respect to a Subsequent Receivable, either January 1, 2005 or February 1, 2005, as applicable. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Subsequent Purchase Agreement&#148; means an agreement by and between the Seller and Franklin Capital pursuant to which the Seller will acquire Subsequent Receivables.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Subsequent Receivables&#148; means the Receivables transferred to the Issuer pursuant to Section 2.2 of this Agreement and the related Subsequent Transfer Agreement, which Receivables shall be listed on Schedule A to the related Subsequent Transfer Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Subsequent Receivables Property&#148; shall have the meaning specified in Section 2.2(a).</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Subsequent Transfer Agreement&#148; has the meaning assigned thereto in Section 2.2(b) of this Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Subsequent Transfer Date&#148; means, with respect to Subsequent Receivables, any date during the Funding Period on which Subsequent Receivables are to be transferred to the Trust pursuant to this Agreement and the related Subsequent Transfer Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Supplemental Servicing Fee&#148; means, with respect to any Monthly Period, charges collected (from whatever source) on the Receivables during such Monthly Period including late fees, prepayment fees, administrative fees and expenses or similar charges allowed by applicable law with respect to Receivables, plus reinvestment proceeds on any payments received in respect of Receivables during the related Monthly Period.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Trust&#148; means the Issuer.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Trust Account Property&#148; means the Trust Accounts, all amounts and investments held from time to time in any Trust Account (whether in the form of deposit accounts, Physical Property, book entry securities, uncertificated securities or otherwise), and all proceeds of the foregoing.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Trust Accounts&#148; has the meaning assigned thereto in Section 5.1(b) of this Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Trust Agreement&#148; means the Amended and Restated Trust Agreement dated as of December 1, 2004 between the Seller and the Owner Trustee, as the same may be amended and supplemented from time to time.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Trust Officer&#148; means, (i) in the case of the Trustee, the chairman or vice chairman of the board of directors, the chairman or vice chairman of the executive committee of the board of directors, the president, any vice president, the secretary, any assistant secretary, the treasurer, any assistant treasurer, the cashier, any assistant cashier, any trust officer or assistant trust officer, the controller and any assistant controller or any other officer of the Trustee customarily performing functions similar to those performed by any of the above designated officers having direct responsibility for the administration of this Agreement and also means, with respect to a particular corporate trust matter, any other officer to whom such matter is referred because of such officer&#146;s knowledge of and familiarity with the particular subject, and (
ii) in the case of the Owner Trustee, any officer in the corporate trust office of the Owner Trustee with direct responsibility for the administration of this Agreement or any of the Basic Documents on behalf of the Owner Trustee.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Trust Property&#148; has the meaning assigned thereto in Section 2.2(a) of this Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;Trustee&#148; means the Person acting as Trustee under the Indenture, its successors in interest and any successor trustee under the Indenture.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>&#147;UCC&#148; means the Uniform Commercial Code as in effect in any relevant jurisdiction.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>SECTION 1.2</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Other Definitional Provisions</U>.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(a)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>Capitalized terms used herein and not otherwise defined herein have the meanings assigned to them in the Indenture, or, if not defined therein, in the Trust Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(b)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>All terms defined in this Agreement shall have the defined meanings when used in any instrument governed hereby and in any certificate or other document made or delivered pursuant hereto unless otherwise defined therein.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(c)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>As used in this Agreement, in any instrument governed hereby and in any certificate or other document made or delivered pursuant hereto or thereto, accounting terms not defined in this Agreement or in any such instrument, certificate or other document, and accounting terms partly defined in this Agreement or in any such instrument, certificate or other document to the extent not defined, shall have the respective meanings given to them under generally accepted accounting principles as in effect on the date of this Agreement or any such instrument, certificate or other document, as applicable. &nbsp;To the extent that the definitions of accounting terms in this Agreement or in any such instrument, certificate or other document are inconsistent with the meanings of such terms under generally accepted accounting principles, the definitions contained in thi
s Agreement or in any such instrument, certificate or other document shall control.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(d)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>The words &#147;hereof,&#148; &#147;herein,&#148; &#147;hereunder&#148; and words of similar import when used in this Agreement shall refer to this Agreement as a whole and not to any particular provision of this Agreement; Section, Schedule and Exhibit references contained in this Agreement are references to Sections, Schedules and Exhibits in or to this Agreement unless otherwise specified; and the term &#147;including&#148; shall mean &#147;including without limitation.&#148;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(e)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>The definitions contained in this Agreement are applicable to the singular as well as the plural forms of such terms and to the masculine as well as to the feminine and neuter genders of such terms.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(f)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>Any agreement, instrument or statute defined or referred to herein or in any instrument or certificate delivered in connection herewith means such agreement, instrument or statute as from time to time amended, modified or supplemented and includes (in the case of agreements or instruments) references to all attachments thereto and instruments incorporated therein; references to a Person are also to its permitted successors and assigns.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:0pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=center>ARTICLE II</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:0pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=center><U>Conveyance of Receivables</U></P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>SECTION 2.1</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Conveyance of Initial Receivables</U>. &nbsp;In consideration of the Issuer&#146;s delivery to or upon the order of the Seller on the Closing Date of (x) the net proceeds from the sale of the Notes, (y) the Certificates and (z) the other amounts to be distributed from time to time to the Seller in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, the Seller does hereby transfer, assign, set over and otherwise convey to the Issuer, without recourse (subject to the obligations set forth herein), all right, title and interest of the Seller in and to, whether now owned or existing or hereafter acquired or arising (collectively, the &#147;Initial Receivables Property&#148;):</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(a)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Initial Receivables and all monies received thereunder on and after the Initial Cutoff Date;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(b)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the security interests in the Financed Vehicles granted by Obligors pursuant to the Initial Receivables and any other interest of the Seller in such Financed Vehicles;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(c)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>any proceeds with respect to the Initial Receivables from claims on any physical damage, credit life or disability insurance policies covering Financed Vehicles or Obligors and any proceeds from the liquidation of the Initial Receivables;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(d)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>any proceeds from any Initial Receivable repurchased by a Dealer, pursuant to a Dealer Agreement, as a result of a breach of representation or warranty in the related Dealer Agreement;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(e)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>all funds on deposit from time to time in the Trust Accounts and in all investments and proceeds thereof and all rights of the Issuer therein;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(f)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>any extended warranty service contracts on the related Financed Vehicles;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(g)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the related Receivable Files;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(h)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Seller&#146;s rights and benefits, but none of its obligations or burdens, under the Purchase Agreement, including the delivery requirements, the representations and warranties and the cure and repurchase obligations of Franklin Capital under the Purchase Agreement; and</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(i)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the proceeds of any and all of the foregoing.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>SECTION 2.2</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Conveyance of Subsequent Receivables</U>.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(a)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>Subject to the conditions set forth in Section 2.2(b) of this Agreement, in consideration of the Issuer&#146;s delivery on each related Subsequent Transfer Date to or upon the order of the Seller of the amount described in Section 5.7(a) to be delivered to the Seller, the Seller does hereby sell, transfer, assign, set over and otherwise convey to the Issuer, without recourse (subject to the obligations set forth herein), all right, title and interest of the Seller in and to, whether now owned or existing or hereafter acquired or arising (collectively, the &#147;Subsequent Receivables Property&#148; and together with the Initial Receivables Property, the &#147;Trust Property&#148;):</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(i)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Subsequent Receivables listed on Schedule A to the related Subsequent Transfer Agreement, and all monies received thereunder on or after the related Subsequent Cutoff Date;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(ii)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the security interests in the Financed Vehicles granted by Obligors pursuant to such Subsequent Receivables and any other interest of the Seller in such Financed Vehicles;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(iii)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>any proceeds with respect to such Subsequent Receivables from claims on any physical damage, credit life or disability insurance policies covering the related Financed Vehicles or Obligors and any proceeds from the liquidation of such Subsequent Receivables;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(iv)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>any proceeds from any Subsequent Receivable repurchased by a Dealer, pursuant to a Dealer Agreement, as a result of a breach of representation or warranty in the related Dealer Agreement; </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(v)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>any extended warranty service contracts on the related Financed Vehicles;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(vi)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the related Receivables Files; </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(vii)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Seller&#146;s rights and benefits, but none of its obligations or burdens, under each of the Subsequent Purchase Agreements, including the delivery requirements, the representations and warranties and the cure and repurchase obligations of Franklin Capital under each of the Subsequent Purchase Agreements; and </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:1584pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(viii)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the proceeds of any and all of the foregoing.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(b)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>The Seller shall transfer to the Issuer the Subsequent Receivables and the other property and rights related thereto described in Section 2.2(a) of this Agreement only upon the satisfaction of each of the following conditions on or prior to the related Subsequent Transfer Date:</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(i)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Seller shall have provided the Trustee, the Owner Trustee, the Security Insurer and the Rating Agencies with an Addition Notice not later than five days prior to any Subsequent Transfer Date and shall have provided any information reasonably requested by any of the foregoing with respect to the Subsequent Receivables;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(ii)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Seller shall have delivered to the Owner Trustee, the Security Insurer and the Trustee a duly executed subsequent transfer agreement substantially in the form of <U>Exhibit A</U> attached hereto (each, a &#147;Subsequent Transfer Agreement&#148; which shall include supplements to Schedule A, listing the Subsequent Receivables);</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(iii)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Seller shall, to the extent required by Section 5.2, have deposited in the Collection Account all collections in respect of the Subsequent Receivables;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(iv)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>as of each Subsequent Transfer Date, (A) the Seller shall not be insolvent and shall not become insolvent as a result of the transfer of Subsequent Receivables on such Subsequent Transfer Date, (B) the Seller shall not intend to incur or believe that it shall incur debts that would be beyond its ability to pay as such debts mature, (C) such transfer shall not have been made with actual intent to hinder, delay or defraud any Person and (D) the assets of the Seller shall not constitute unreasonably small capital to carry out its business as conducted;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(v)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Funding Period shall not have terminated;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(vi)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>each of the representations and warranties made by the Seller pursuant to Section 3.1 with respect to the Subsequent Receivables to be transferred on such Subsequent Transfer Date shall be true and correct as of the related Subsequent Transfer Date, and the Seller shall have performed all obligations to be performed by it hereunder on or prior to such Subsequent Transfer Date;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(vii)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Seller shall, at its own expense, on or prior to the Subsequent Transfer Date indicate in its computer files that the Subsequent Receivables identified in the Subsequent Transfer Agreement have been sold to the Trust pursuant to this Agreement;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(viii)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Seller shall have taken any action required to maintain the first priority perfected security interest of the Trust in the Owner Trust Estate and the first priority perfected security interest of the Indenture Collateral Agent in the Collateral;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(ix)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>no selection procedures adverse to the interests of the Noteholders or the Security Insurer shall have been utilized in selecting the Subsequent Receivables;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(x)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the addition of any such Subsequent Receivables shall not result in a material adverse tax consequence to the Trust, the Noteholders, or the Security Insurer; </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(xi)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Security Insurer (so long as no Insurer Default shall have occurred and be continuing), in its absolute and sole discretion, shall have approved in writing the transfer of such Subsequent Receivables to the Trust as evidenced by the Security Insurer&#146;s signature on the Subsequent Transfer Agreement; </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(xii)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Initial Receivables, together with the Subsequent Receivables (if any) in the Trust (after giving effect to any transfer of Subsequent Receivables on a Subsequent Transfer Date), shall meet the following criteria (based on the characteristics of the Initial Receivables on the Initial Cutoff Date and the Subsequent Receivables on the related Subsequent Cutoff Dates): </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>A.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the weighted average APR of the Receivables shall not be less than 8.77%; </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>B.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>not more than approximately 31.5% of the aggregate Principal Balance of the Receivables shall consist of Obligors whose mailing addresses are in Arizona; </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>C.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>not more than 10% of the aggregate Principal Balance of the Receivables shall have Obligors whose mailing addresses are in any one state other than California, Arizona, Nevada or New Mexico unless an Opinion of Counsel acceptable to the Rating Agencies and the Security Insurer with respect to the security interest in the related Financed Vehicles is furnished by the Seller on or prior to the related Subsequent Transfer Date;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>D.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>at least 27% of the Receivables shall have an original term to maturity of not more than 60 months;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:576pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>E.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>not more than 73% of the Receivables shall have an original term to maturity of 61 months or greater;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>F.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>not more than 3% of the Receivables shall have an original term to maturity of greater than 72 months;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>G.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>at least 49% of the Receivables shall be comprised of Receivables secured by new Financed Vehicles;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>H.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>at least 55% of the Receivables shall be comprised of Prime Receivables with at least 35% of the Receivables comprised of fast fund and platinum programs;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>I.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>not more than 43% of the Receivables shall be comprised of Non-Prime Receivables, with Receivables originated under the copper program comprising no more than 10% of the Receivables and Receivables originated under the bronze program comprising no more than 8.75% of the Receivables, with Receivables originated under the dealer special program comprising no more than 10% of the Receivables; and </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>J.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:72pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>not more than 1.3% of the Receivables shall be comprised of Sub-Prime Receivables; </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(xiii)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Servicer shall have delivered the Officer&#146;s Certificate described in Section 3.4(c) of this Agreement; and</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(xiv)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding-left:36pt; padding-top:0pt; padding-right:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>the Seller shall have delivered to the Security Insurer and the Trustee an Officers&#146; Certificate confirming the satisfaction of each condition precedent specified in this Section 2.2(b).</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:0pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>The Seller covenants that in the event any of the foregoing conditions precedent are not satisfied with respect to any Subsequent Receivable on the date required as specified above, the Seller will immediately repurchase such Subsequent Receivable from the Trust, at a price equal to the Purchase Amount thereof, in the manner specified in Section 4.7.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:0pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>It is the intention of the Seller that the transfer and assignment contemplated by this Agreement shall constitute a sale of the Receivables and other Trust Property from the Seller to the Issuer for non-tax purposes and the beneficial interest in and title to the Receivables and the other Trust Property shall not be part of the Seller&#146;s estate in the event of the filing of a bankruptcy petition by or against the Seller under any bankruptcy law. &nbsp;In the event that, notwithstanding the intent of the Seller, the transfer and assignment contemplated hereby is held not to be a sale, this Agreement shall constitute a security agreement, and the Seller hereby grants to the Issuer for the benefit of the Noteholders, the Certificateholders and the Security Insurer, a security interest in the property referred to in Section 2.1 and Section 2.2(a) whether
 now owned or existing or hereafter acquired or arising.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:0pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=center>ARTICLE III</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:0pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=center><U>The Receivables</U></P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>SECTION 3.1</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Representations and Warranties of the Seller</U>. &nbsp;The Seller makes the following representations and warranties as to the Receivables on which the Issuer is deemed to have relied in acquiring the Receivables and upon which the Security Insurer shall be deemed to rely in issuing the Note Policy. &nbsp;Such representations and warranties speak as of the execution and delivery of this Agreement and as of the Closing Date, in the case of the Initial Receivables, and as of the applicable Subsequent Transfer Date, in the case of the Subsequent Receivables (unless another date or time period is otherwise specified or indicated in the particular representation or warranty), but shall survive the sale, transfer and assignment of the Receivables to the Issuer and the pledge thereof to the Trustee pursuant to the Indenture. &nbsp;The representations set f
orth in Sections 3.1(a), (b), (h), (i) and (r) may not be waived.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(a)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Title</U>. &nbsp;Immediately prior to the transfer and assignment herein contemplated, the Seller had good and marketable title to each Receivable, free and clear of all Liens and, immediately upon the transfer thereof, the Trust shall have good and marketable title to each such Receivable, free and clear of all Liens (or a valid first priority perfected security interest in such Receivable); and the transfer of the Receivables to the Trust has been perfected under the UCC. &nbsp;No Dealer or any other Person has any right to receive proceeds of any Receivables.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(b)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>All Filings Made</U>. &nbsp;All filings (including, without limitation, UCC filings) necessary in any jurisdiction to give the Trust a first priority perfected ownership interest in the Receivables, and to give the Indenture Collateral Agent a first priority perfected security interest therein, on behalf of the Issuer Secured Parties shall have been made. &nbsp;All financing statements filed or to be filed against the Seller in favor of the Trust in connection herewith describing the Receivables contain a statement to the following effect &#147;A purchase of or security interest in any collateral described in this financing statement will violate the rights of the Trust.&#148;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(c)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Characteristics of Receivables</U>. &nbsp;Each Receivable (i) was originated in the United States of America and is denominated in United States dollars by a Dealer in connection with the retail sale of a Financed Vehicle in the ordinary course of such Dealer&#146;s business, was fully and properly executed by the parties thereto, was purchased by the Seller from Franklin Capital which in turn shall have purchased such Receivable from such Dealer under an existing dealer agreement with Franklin Capital, and shall have been validly assigned by Franklin Capital to the Seller in accordance with its terms, (ii) shall have created or, with respect to the Subsequent Receivables, shall create (no later than the applicable Subsequent Transfer Date) a valid, subsisting and enforceable first priority perfected security interest in favor of Franklin Capital in 
the Financed Vehicle, which security interest has been assigned by Franklin Capital to the Seller, which in turn has been assigned or, with respect to the Subsequent Receivables, will be assigned (no later than the applicable Subsequent Transfer Date) by the Seller to the Trust, (iii) shall contain customary and enforceable provisions such that the rights and remedies of the holder thereof shall be adequate for realization against the collateral of the benefits of the security, (iv) shall provide for level monthly payments (provided that the payment in the first or last month in the life of the Receivable may be different from the level payment) that fully amortize the Amount Financed by maturity and (v) provides for calculation of interest in accordance with the Simple Interest Method. Except as otherwise evidenced in the Receivable File relating thereto, the terms of each Receivable have not been amended and collections relating to such Receivable have not been waived.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(d)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Schedule of Receivables</U>. &nbsp;The information set forth in Schedule A to this Agreement (the &#147;Schedule of Receivables&#148;) is true and correct in all material respects as of the Initial Cutoff Date, in the case of the Initial Receivables, and as of the related Subsequent Cutoff Date, in the case of any Subsequent Receivables, and no selection procedures believed by the Seller to be adverse to the Noteholders or the Security Insurer were utilized in selecting the Receivables. &nbsp;The Computer Tape regarding the Receivables is true and correct in all material respects as of the Initial Cutoff Date, in the case of the Initial Receivables, and as of the applicable Subsequent Cutoff Date, in the case of any Subsequent Receivables.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(e)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Compliance With Law</U>. &nbsp;Each Receivable complied at the time it was originated or made and, in the case of the Initial Receivables, complies at the execution of this Agreement or, in the case of any Subsequent Receivables, complies on the related Subsequent Transfer Date, in each case in all material respects with all requirements of applicable Federal, state and local laws and regulations thereunder, including, without limitation, usury laws, the Federal Truth in Lending Act, the Equal Credit Opportunity Act, the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, the Federal Trade Commission Act, the Magnuson Moss Warranty Act, the Rees Levering Act, the Federal Reserve Board&#146;s Regulations B and Z, state adaptations of the National Consumer Act and other consumer credit laws and equal credit opportunity and disclosure law
s.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(f)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Binding Obligation</U>. &nbsp;Each Receivable represents the legal, valid and binding payment obligation in writing of the Obligor thereunder, enforceable by the holder thereof in accordance with its terms except as such enforceability may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, moratorium, fraudulent conveyance, reorganization and similar laws now or hereafter in effect related to or affecting creditors&#146; rights generally and subject to general principles of equity (whether applied in a proceeding at law or in equity); and all parties to each Receivable had full legal capacity to execute and deliver such Receivable and all other documents related thereto and to grant the security interest purported to be granted thereby.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(g)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>No Government Obligor</U>. &nbsp;None of the Receivables are due from the United States of America or any State or from any agency, department or instrumentality of the United States of America or any State.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(h)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Valid and Continuing Security Interest; No other pledges</U>. &nbsp;This Agreement creates a valid and continuing security interest in the Receivables in favor of the Trust, which security interest is prior to all other Liens, and is enforceable against such creditors of and purchasers from the Seller to the Trust. &nbsp;Other than the security interest granted to the Trust pursuant to this Agreement, the Seller has not pledged, assigned, sold or granted a security interest in, or otherwise conveyed any of the Receivables. &nbsp;The Seller has not authorized the filing of and is not aware of any financing statements against the Seller that include a description of collateral covering the Receivables other than any financing statement related to the security interest granted to the Trust pursuant to this Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(i)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Security Interest in Financed Vehicle</U>. &nbsp;Immediately prior to the sale, assignment and transfer thereof to the Trust, each Receivable is secured by a validly perfected first priority security interest in the Financed Vehicle in favor of Franklin Capital as secured party or all necessary and appropriate actions have been commenced that would result in the valid perfection of a first priority security interest in the Financed Vehicle in favor of Franklin Capital as secured party. &nbsp;Immediately after the sale, assignment and transfer thereof to the Trust pursuant to this Agreement, although the Lien Certificate will indicate Franklin Capital as lienholder and will not indicate the Trust or Owner Trustee as secured party, each Receivable will be secured by an enforceable and perfected security interest in the Financed Vehicle in favor of the 
Trust as secured party for the benefit of the Noteholders and the Security Insurer, which security interest is prior to all other Liens in such Financed Vehicle.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(j)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Receivables in Force</U>. &nbsp;As of the Closing Date, no Initial Receivable has been satisfied, subordinated or rescinded, nor has any related Financed Vehicle been released from the Lien granted by the related Initial Receivable in whole or in part. &nbsp;As of the related Subsequent Transfer Date, no Subsequent Receivable has been satisfied, subordinated or rescinded, nor has any related Financed Vehicle been released from the Lien granted by the related Subsequent Receivable in whole or in part.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(k)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>No Waiver</U>. &nbsp;No provision of a Receivable has been waived except as reflected in the Receivable File relating to such Receivable.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(l)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>No Defenses</U>. &nbsp;As of the Closing Date, no right of rescission, setoff, counterclaim or defense, including, without limitation, the defense of usury, has been asserted or threatened with respect to any Initial Receivable. &nbsp;As of the related Subsequent Transfer Date, no right of rescission, setoff, counterclaim or defense, including, without limitation, the defense of usury, has been asserted or threatened with respect to any Subsequent Receivable.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(m)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>No Liens</U>. &nbsp;To the best of the Seller&#146;s knowledge, as of the Closing Date in the case of an Initial Receivable and the related Subsequent Transfer Date in the case of a Subsequent Receivable there are no Liens or claims, including Liens for work, labor, materials or unpaid state or federal taxes relating to any Financed Vehicle securing the related Receivable, that are or may be prior to or equal to the Lien granted by such Receivable.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(n)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>No Default</U>. &nbsp;No Initial Receivable has a payment that is more than 30 days delinquent as of the Initial Cutoff Date and no Subsequent Receivable has a payment that is more than 30 days delinquent as of the related Subsequent Cutoff Date and, except for any delinquency in payment on any Receivable not more than 30 days delinquent, no default, breach, violation or event (in any such case) permitting acceleration under the terms of any Receivable has occurred; and except for any delinquency in payment on any Receivable not more than 30 days delinquent, no continuing condition that with notice or the lapse of time would constitute a default, breach, violation or event (in any such case) permitting acceleration under the terms of any Receivable shall have arisen as of the Initial Cutoff Date, in the case of the Initial Receivables, and as of the 
related Subsequent Cutoff Date, in the case of any Subsequent Receivables; and the Seller has not waived and shall not waive any of the foregoing. &nbsp;For purposes of this clause (m), a Receivable is considered 30 days delinquent if 30 days have elapsed since the date on which a scheduled payment had been due but not been made. &nbsp;As of the Closing Date, no Initial Receivable has had an uncured First Payment Default. &nbsp;As of the related Subsequent Transfer Date, no Subsequent Receivable has had an uncured First Payment Default. </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(o)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>No Bankruptcies</U>. &nbsp;No Obligor on any Receivable was the subject of a bankruptcy proceeding commenced following the execution of the related Contract except an Obligor that has received a discharge or dismissal under the United States Bankruptcy Code.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(p)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>No Repossessions</U>. &nbsp;As of the Initial Cutoff Date, no Financed Vehicle securing any Initial Receivable is in repossession status. &nbsp;As of the related Subsequent Cutoff Date, no Financed Vehicle securing any Subsequent Receivable is in repossession status.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(q)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Adverse Selection</U>. &nbsp;No selection procedures adverse to the Noteholders or the Security Insurer were utilized in selecting the Receivables from those owned by Franklin Capital which met the selection criteria contained in this Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(r)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Chattel Paper</U>. &nbsp;Each Receivable constitutes &#147;tangible chattel paper&#148; as defined in the UCC. &nbsp;The Receivables do not have any marks or notations indicating that they have been pledged, assigned or otherwise conveyed to any Person other than the Trust or the Trustee. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(s)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Insurance</U>. &nbsp;Under the terms of each Receivable the Obligor is required to maintain physical damage insurance or comprehensive and collision insurance covering the Financed Vehicle.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(t)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Lawful Assignment</U>. &nbsp;No Receivable was originated in, as of the Initial Cutoff Date, in the case of the Initial Receivables, or as of the related Subsequent Cutoff Date, in the case of any Subsequent Receivables, or is subject to the laws of, any jurisdiction under which the sale, transfer and assignment of such Receivable or this Agreement is unlawful, void or voidable.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(u)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Reserved</U>.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(v)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>One Original</U>. &nbsp;There is only one original executed copy of each Receivable; immediately prior to the constructive delivery thereof to the Trustee pursuant to Section 3.3, such copy shall have been in the custody and possession of the Seller or Franklin Capital.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(w)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Location of Receivable Files</U>. &nbsp;The Receivable Files are kept at one or more of the locations listed in Schedule B and each item required to be in a Receivable File is in such Receivable File.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(x)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Computer Records</U>. &nbsp;As of the Closing Date, the accounting and computer records relating to the Initial Receivables of the Seller have been marked to show the absolute ownership by the Owner Trustee on behalf of the Trust of the Initial Receivables. &nbsp;As of the related Subsequent Transfer Date, the accounting and computer records relating to Subsequent Receivables have been marked to show the absolute ownership by the Owner Trustee on behalf of the Trust of the related Subsequent Receivables. </P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(y)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Taxes</U>. &nbsp;To the knowledge of the Seller, there are no state or local taxing jurisdictions which have asserted that nonresident holders of notes issued by a trust which holds assets similar to the assets to be held by the Trust are subject to the jurisdiction&#146;s income or other taxes solely by reason of the location in the jurisdiction of the Owner Trustee, the Seller, the Servicer, the Representative, the obligors on or the assets securing the Receivables held by the Trust, or the issuer of a financial guaranty insurance policy.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(z)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Maturity of Receivables</U>. &nbsp;As of the Initial Cutoff Date, each Initial Receivable has a final maturity date not later than December 5, 2011; each Initial Receivable has an original term to maturity of not more than 84 months; the weighted average original term of the Initial Receivables is approximately 68 months; and the weighted average remaining term of the Initial Receivables is approximately 61 months. &nbsp;No Initial Receivable shall have a remaining term of less than six months as of the Initial Cutoff Date and no Subsequent Receivable shall have a remaining term of less than six months as of the applicable Subsequent Cutoff Date.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(aa)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Financing</U>. &nbsp;As of the Initial Cutoff Date, approximately 50.34% of the aggregate Principal Balance of the Initial Receivables represent new vehicles; the remainder of the Initial Receivables represent used vehicles; and 100% of the aggregate Principal Balance of the Initial Receivables represent Simple Interest Receivables. &nbsp;As of the Initial Cutoff Date, approximately 56.09% of the aggregate Principal Balance of the Initial Receivables represent Prime Receivables, approximately 42.70% of the aggregate Principal Balance of the Initial Receivables represent Non-Prime Receivables and approximately 1.21% of the aggregate Principal Balance of the Initial Receivables represent Sub-Prime Receivables. &nbsp;As of the Initial Cutoff Date, the aggregate Principal Balance of the Initial Receivables is $175,025,000.18.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(bb)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>APR</U>. &nbsp;As of the Initial Cutoff Date, the weighted average Annual Percentage Rate of the Initial Receivables is approximately 8.93% (after giving effect to the discounting of the Discounted Receivables). &nbsp;Each Initial Receivable has and each Subsequent Receivable will have an APR equal to or greater than 3.99% (after giving effect to the discounting of the Discounted Receivables).</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(cc)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Number</U>. &nbsp;As of the Initial Cutoff Date, there are 10,664 Initial Receivables.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(dd)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Balance</U>. &nbsp;As of the Initial Cutoff Date, each Initial Receivable has a remaining Principal Balance of not less than $1,101.39 and not more than $117,520.94, and as of the Initial Cutoff Date the average Principal Balance of the Initial Receivables is $16,412.84.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(ee)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Finance Charge</U>. &nbsp;Each Receivable provides for the payment of a finance charge calculated on the basis of the APR stated in the related Contract and such APR has not been modified except as otherwise required under the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(ff)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Force Placed Insurance</U>. No Receivable is subject to a force placed insurance policy on the related Financed Vehicle.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:36pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>SECTION 3.2</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify><U>Repurchase upon Breach</U>. &nbsp;(a) &nbsp;The Representative, the Seller, the Servicer, the Security Insurer or the Issuer, as the case may be, shall inform the other parties to this Agreement and the Trustee promptly, in writing, upon the discovery of any breach of the Representative&#146;s or the Seller&#146;s representations and warranties made pursuant to Section 3.1. &nbsp;The Representative, the Seller, the Servicer, the Security Insurer or the Issuer, as the case may be shall inform Franklin Capital, promptly, in writing, upon the discovery of any breach of Franklin Capital&#146;s representations and warranties made pursuant to Section 3.02(b) of the Purchase Agreement. &nbsp;As of the last day of the second (or, if the Representative or the Seller so elects, the first) month following the discovery by the Representative or the Seller or rec
eipt by the Representative or the Seller of notice from any of the Representative, the Seller, the Servicer, the Security Insurer or the Issuer of such breach, unless such breach is cured by such date, the Representative and the Seller shall jointly and severally have an obligation to repurchase (and, if necessary, the Issuer shall enforce the obligations of Franklin Capital under Section 6.02 of the Purchase Agreement) any Receivable in which the interests of the Noteholders or the Security Insurer are materially and adversely affected by any such breach as of such date. &nbsp;The &#147;second month&#148; shall mean the month following the month in which discovery occurs or notice is given, and the &#147;first month&#148; shall mean the month in which discovery occurs or notice is given. &nbsp;In consideration of and simultaneously with the repurchase of the Receivable, the Representative and/or the Seller shall remit, or the Seller shall cause Franklin Capital to remit pursuant to the Purchase Agreement, t
o the Collection Account the Purchase Amount in the manner specified in Section 5.5 and the Issuer shall execute such assignments and other documents reasonably requested by such person in order to effect such repurchase. &nbsp;The sole remedy of the Issuer, the Owner Trustee, the Trustee, the Noteholders or the Certificateholders with respect to a breach of representations and warranties pursuant to Section 3.1 and the agreement contained in this Section shall be the repurchase of Receivables pursuant to this Section, subject to the conditions contained herein or to enforce the obligations of Franklin Capital to the Seller to repurchase such Receivables pursuant to the Purchase Agreement. &nbsp;Neither the Owner Trustee nor the Trustee shall have a duty to conduct any affirmative investigation as to the occurrence of any conditions requiring the repurchase of any Receivable pursuant to this Section.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(b)</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:108pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>Pursuant to Section 2.1 of this Agreement, the Seller conveyed to the Trust all of the Seller&#146;s right, title and interest in its rights and benefits, but none of its obligations or burdens, under the Purchase Agreement including the Seller&#146;s rights under the Purchase Agreement and the delivery requirements, the representations and warranties and the cure or repurchase obligations of Franklin Capital thereunder. &nbsp;The Seller hereby represents and warrants to the Trust that such assignment is valid, enforceable and effective to permit the Trust to enforce such obligations of Franklin Capital under the Purchase Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-left:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding:0pt; text-indent:72pt; line-height:12pt; font-size:12pt; color:#000000" align=justify>(c)</P>
